intro: Centaurium acutum, commonly known as narrowleaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. Centaurium acutum is often found in habitats with partial shade and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
